content.question:
Suppose a new regulation requires businesses to pay all employees a minimum wage of <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>15.00</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> per hour. A small coffee shop currently has <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees—<math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees whose wages are less than <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour and <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees whose wages are more than <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour. To meet the new regulation, the coffee shop plans to increase the wages of the <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees whose wages are less than <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour to <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour. The other <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees will not receive a wage increase at this time.

Which of the following must be true about the median wage of the <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees after the wage increase occurs?

choices.label: The median wage will be greater than <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour.
The median wage will increase but will be less than <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour.
The median wage will be <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour.
The median wage will not change.
The median wage cannot be determined from the information provided.

content.answer: The median wage will be <math alttext="$15.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>15.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
